packageMeta.name: purescript-electron
packageMeta.description: FFI bindings for the Electron API

declarations.comments: The `ELECTRON` effect represents computations which require and affect the Electron environment.
declarations.title: ELECTRON

declarations.comments:
Emitted when the application is activated. Various actions can trigger this
event, such as launching the application for the first time, attempting to
re-launch the application when it's already running, or clicking on the
application's dock or taskbar icon.

[Official Electron documentation](https://electronjs.org/docs/api/app#event-activate-macos)
declarations.title: onActivate

declarations.comments:
Emitted when Electron has finished initialization.

[Official Electron documentation](http://electron.atom.io/docs/all/#event-39-ready-39)
declarations.title: onReady

declarations.comments: Change the window's width in pixels. Default is 800.
declarations.title: changeWidth

declarations.comments: Change the window's height in pixels. Default is 600.
declarations.title: changeHeight

declarations.comments: Do not show the window when created.
declarations.title: hidden

declarations.comments:
Open a window without toolbars, borders, or other graphical "chrome".

[Official Electron documentation](https://electronjs.org/docs/api/frameless-window)
declarations.title: frameless

declarations.comments: Allow an https page to run JavaScript, CSS or plugins from http URLs.
declarations.title: allowRunningInsecureContent

declarations.comments:
The default zoom factor of the page, `3.0` represents `300%`. Default is
`1.0`.
declarations.title: changeZoomFactor

declarations.comments:
Try to close the window. This has the same effect as a user manually
clicking the close button of the window. The web page may cancel the close
though.

[Official Electron documentation](https://electronjs.org/docs/api/browser-window#winclose)
declarations.title: close

declarations.comments:
Minimizes the window. On some platforms the minimized window will be shown
in the Dock.

[Official Electron documentation](https://electronjs.org/docs/api/browser-window#winminimize)
declarations.title: minimize

declarations.comments:
Shows and gives focus to the window.

[Official Electron documentation](https://electronjs.org/docs/api/browser-window#winshow)
declarations.title: show

declarations.comments:
Emitted when the window is closed. After you have received this event you
should remove the reference to the window and avoid using it any more.

[Official Electron documentation](https://electronjs.org/docs/api/browser-window#event-closed)
declarations.title: onClosed

declarations.comments:
Emitted when the web page has been rendered (while not being shown) and
window can be displayed without a visual flash.

[Official Electron documentation](https://electronjs.org/docs/api/browser-window#event-ready-to-show)
declarations.title: onceReadyToShow

declarations.comments:
Emitted when a redirect is received while requesting a resource.

[Official Electron documentation](http://electron.atom.io/docs/api/web-contents/#event-did-get-redirect-request)
declarations.title: onDidGetRedirectRequest

declarations.comments:
Emitted when a navigation is done.

[Official Electron documentation](http://electron.atom.io/docs/api/web-contents/#event-did-navigate)
declarations.title: onDidNavigate

declarations.comments:
Emitted when an in-page navigation happened.

[Official Electron documentation](http://electron.atom.io/docs/api/web-contents/#event-did-navigate-in-page)
declarations.title: onDidNavigateInPage

declarations.comments:
Emitted when the document in the given frame is loaded.

[Official Electron documentation](http://electron.atom.io/docs/api/web-contents/#event-dom-ready)
declarations.title: onDomReady

declarations.comments:
Opens the devtools.

[Official Electron documentation](http://electron.atom.io/docs/all/#webcontents-opendevtools-options)
declarations.title: openDevTools

declarations.comments:
Listens to channel, when a new message arrives the listener is called.

[Official Electron documentation](http://electron.atom.io/docs/api/ipc-main/#ipcmainonchannel-listener)
declarations.title: on

declarations.comments:
Adds a one time listener function for the event.
This listener is invoked only the next time a message is sent to channel,
after which it is removed.

[Official Electron documentation](http://electron.atom.io/docs/api/ipc-main/#ipcmainoncechannel-listener)
declarations.title: once

declarations.comments:
Removes the specified listener from the listener array for the
specified channel.

[Official Electron documentation](http://electron.atom.io/docs/api/ipc-main/#ipcmainremovelistenerchannel-listener)
declarations.title: removeListener

declarations.comments:
Removes all listeners.

[Official Electron documentation](http://electron.atom.io/docs/api/ipc-main/#ipcmainremovealllistenerschannel)
declarations.title: removeAllListeners

declarations.comments: Removes all listeners for the specified channel.
declarations.title: removeAllChannelListeners

declarations.comments: Event object
declarations.title: sender

declarations.comments:
Listens to channel, when a new message arrives the listener is called.

[Official Electron documentation](http://electron.atom.io/docs/api/ipc-renderer/#ipcrendereronchannel-listener)
declarations.title: on

declarations.comments:
Adds a one time listener function for the event.
This listener is invoked only the next time a message is sent to channel,
after which it is removed.

[Official Electron documentation](http://electron.atom.io/docs/api/ipc-renderer/#ipcrendereroncechannel-listener)
declarations.title: once

declarations.comments:
Removes the specified listener from the listener array for the
specified channel.

[Official Electron documentation](http://electron.atom.io/docs/api/ipc-renderer/#ipcrendererremovelistenerchannel-listener)
declarations.title: removeListener

declarations.comments:
Removes all listeners.

[Official Electron documentation](http://electron.atom.io/docs/api/ipc-renderer/#ipcrendererremovealllistenerschannel)
declarations.title: removeAllListeners

declarations.comments:
Send a message to the main process asynchronously via channel.

[Official Electron documentation](http://electron.atom.io/docs/api/ipc-renderer/#ipcrenderersendchannel-arg1-arg2-)
declarations.title: send

declarations.comments:
Send a message to the main process synchronously via channel.

[Official Electron documentation](http://electron.atom.io/docs/api/ipc-renderer/#ipcrenderersendsyncchannel-arg1-arg2-)
declarations.title: sendSync

declarations.comments:
Like ipcRenderer.send but the event will be sent to the <webview> element in the host page instead of the main process.

[Official Electron documentation](http://electron.atom.io/docs/api/ipc-renderer/#ipcrenderersendtohostchannel-arg1-arg2-)
declarations.title: sendToHost

declarations.comments: Show the given file in a file manager. If possible, select the file.
declarations.title: showItemInFolder

declarations.comments: Open the given file in the desktop's default manner.
declarations.title: openItem

declarations.comments:
Open the given external protocol URL in the desktop's default manner.
(For example, mailto: URLs in the user's default mail agent.)
declarations.title: openExternal

declarations.comments: Move the given file to trash and returns a boolean status for the operation.
declarations.title: moveItemToTrash

declarations.comments: Play the beep sound.
declarations.title: beep

declarations.comments:
A boxed function that can be used as an event listener. This is necessary
due to the underling implementation of Eff functions.
declarations.title: Listener

declarations.comments: Creates a Listener from a normal PureScript Eff function.
declarations.title: mkListener
